alert.note: Alert for Paradox Valley, Lower Dolores River; Uncompahgre Plateau, Dallas Divide (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 3:52PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central San Miguel and south central Montrose Counties through 430 PM MDT... At 352 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Norwood, or 32 miles southwest of Montrose, moving west at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of north central San Miguel and south central Montrose Counties, including the following locations... Redvale. This includes the following highways... Colorado 141 between mile markers 49 and 57. Colorado 145 between mile markers 100 and 116. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Paradox Valley, Lower Dolores River; Uncompahgre Plateau, Dallas Divide
